title: aggregate-metadata breaks search

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
#### What is the problem?
I got the error:
`type object got multiple values for keyword argument 'type' [search.py:_get_search_index:379] (TypeError) `
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```shell
(datalad) ➜  /tmp mkdir metadatarepo 
(datalad) ➜  /tmp cd metadatarepo 
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo datalad create
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/metadatarepo 
create(ok): /tmp/metadatarepo (dataset)                                                             
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) git config --file .datalad/config --add datalad.metadata.nativetype image
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) ✗ cp ../pics/cat1.jpg .
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) ✗ datalad add cat1.jpg 
add(ok): /tmp/metadatarepo/cat1.jpg (file)                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
save(ok): /tmp/metadatarepo (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) ✗ datalad aggregate-metadata                                        
[INFO   ] Aggregate metadata for dataset /tmp/metadatarepo 
[INFO   ] Update aggregate metadata in dataset at: /tmp/metadatarepo 
aggregate_metadata(ok): /tmp/metadatarepo (dataset)                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
[INFO   ] Attempting to save 6 files/datasets 
save(ok): /tmp/metadatarepo (dataset)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
action summary:
  aggregate_metadata (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) ✗ datalad search --show-keys
[INFO   ] Building search index 
[INFO   ] Scanning for metadata keys 
[ERROR  ] type object got multiple values for keyword argument 'type' [search.py:_get_search_index:379] (TypeError) 
(datalad) ➜  metadatarepo git:(master) ✗ datalad search cat
[INFO   ] Rebuilding search index 
[INFO   ] Scanning for metadata keys 
[ERROR  ] type object got multiple values for keyword argument 'type' [search.py:_get_search_index:379] (TypeError) 
```
#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad plugin wtf`)?
datalad 0.9.1.dev548
